elements.content: Modular construction of 3D coordination frameworks incorporating SiF62− links: Accessing the significance of [M(pyrazole)4{SiF6}] synthon†Vira V. PonomarovaVasiliy V. KomarchukIshtvan BoldogHarald Krautscheid and Konstantin V. Domasevitchnbonozpcu1–63454,6789,101112(a) Bitopic conformationally flexible Me4bpz linker examined in the present study; (b) Discrete and (c) 1D polymeric motifs supported by SiF62− (represented as octahedra) and metal–pyrazole portion. Note the concerted action of coordination and hydrogen bonding and how the interconversion of the motifs may be controlled by the terminal NCS−.

(a) Bitopic conformationally flexible Me4bpz linker examined in the present study; (b) Discrete and (c) 1D polymeric motifs supported by SiF62- (represented as octahedra) and metal-pyrazole portion. Note the concerted action of coordination and hydrogen bonding and how the interconversion of the motifs may be controlled by the terminal NCS-.

Note the concerted action of coordination and hydrogen bonding and how the interconversion of the motifs may be controlled by the terminal NCS−.

Hexafluorosilicate link between the adjacent [Cd(Me4bpz)2]n layers, as it occurs in 2. Note the perfectly complementary donor and acceptor functionalities resulting in an eight-fold NH⋯F bonding.

cln_elements.content: Scheme 1 (a) Bitopic conformationally flexible Me4bpz linker examined in the present study; (b) Discrete and (c) 1D polymeric motifs supported by SiF62− (represented as octahedra) and metal–pyrazole portion. Note the concerted action of coordination and hydrogen bonding and how the interconversion of the motifs may be controlled by the terminal NCS−.
cln_elements.clean_text: Scheme 1  (a) Bitopic conformationally flexible Me4bpz linker examined in the present study; (b) Discrete and (c) 1D polymeric motifs supported by SiF62- (represented as octahedra) and metal-pyrazole portion. Note the concerted action of coordination and hydrogen bonding and how the interconversion of the motifs may be controlled by the terminal NCS-.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 1 (a) Two-fold interpenetration of NbO-type frameworks in 1; (b) Double-helical strand supported by NH⋯S hydrogen bonds, which link together two independent interpenetrated frameworks.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 1  (a) Two-fold interpenetration of NbO-type frameworks in 1; (b) Double-helical strand supported by NH⋯S hydrogen bonds, which link together two independent interpenetrated frameworks.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 2 Hexafluorosilicate link between the adjacent [Cd(Me4bpz)2]n layers, as it occurs in 2. Note the perfectly complementary donor and acceptor functionalities resulting in an eight-fold NH⋯F bonding.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 2  Hexafluorosilicate link between the adjacent [Cd(Me4bpz)2]n layers, as it occurs in 2. Note the perfectly complementary donor and acceptor functionalities resulting in an eight-fold NH⋯F bonding.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 3 (a) Hydrogen bonding pattern adopted by SiF62− anion in 3, with double NH⋯F bonds to cis-pyrazole groups; (b) fragment of framework in 3 showing SiF62− links embedded into the metal–organic net.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 3  (a) Hydrogen bonding pattern adopted by SiF62- anion in 3, with double NH⋯F bonds to cis-pyrazole groups; (b) fragment of framework in 3 showing SiF62- links embedded into the metal-organic net.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 4 Inorganic links between 44 coordination layers [Cd(Me4bpz)22+]n of different shape (indicated with a grey strip): (a) SiF62−-pillared flat networks in 4 and (b) SiF62−-connected corrugated layers in 2.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 4  Inorganic links between 44 coordination layers [Cd(Me4bpz)22+]n of different shape (indicated with a grey strip): (a) SiF62--pillared flat networks in 4 and (b) SiF62--connected corrugated layers in 2.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 5 Function of SiF62− anions as inorganic links between the coordination layers in 4 (a) and 5 (b). Note the mode of the NH⋯F bonding, which is individual in each case.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 5  Function of SiF62- anions as inorganic links between the coordination layers in 4 (a) and 5 (b). Note the mode of the NH⋯F bonding, which is individual in each case.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 6 View of 3D pcu frameworks in 4 (a) and 5 (b) along a direction of inorganic [Cd(SiF6)]n chains, which demonstrates variations in the size of the channels, orientation of the organic tectons and the shape of the frameworks.
cln_elements.clean_text: Fig. 6  View of 3D pcu frameworks in 4 (a) and 5 (b) along a direction of inorganic [Cd(SiF6)]n chains, which demonstrates variations in the size of the channels, orientation of the organic tectons and the shape of the frameworks.
